bibl.title: Bilingual Notaries in Hellenistic Egypt. A Study of Greek as a Second Language.
bibl.publisher: Koninklijke Vlaamse Academie van België voor Wetenschappen en Kunsten. Comité Klassieke Studies
bibl.note: Ph.D. Univ. of Helsinki, 2011. - 1. Introduction. - 2. Linguistic Landscape of Hellenistic Egypt. - 3. Language Use in the Pathyrite Area. - 4. Notaries at Work. - 5. Phonology and Related Issues. - 6. Morphosyntax - Use of Cases. - 7. Syntactic Transfer from L1. - 8. General Conclusions. - Appendices: A. Concordances; - B. Genealogy of the Family of the Agoranomoi; - C. Structure of the Agoranomic Contract and Three Samples; - D. Document Groups: Scribal Practices and Variation. - General Index.
bibl.seg: Vierros Marja, Bilingual Notaries in Hellenistic Egypt. A Study of Greek as a Second Language. (Collectanea Hellenistica. V.)
Brussel, Koninklijke Vlaamse Academie van België voor Wetenschappen en Kunsten. Comité Klassieke Studies, 2012, 4°, 291 pp., 21 tabl., 3 figg. ISBN 978-90-6569-103-3. €19,50.

Ph.D. Univ. of Helsinki, 2011. - 1. Introduction. - 2. Linguistic Landscape of Hellenistic Egypt. - 3. Language Use in the Pathyrite Area. - 4. Notaries at Work. - 5. Phonology and Related Issues. - 6. Morphosyntax - Use of Cases. - 7. Syntactic Transfer from L1. - 8. General Conclusions. - Appendices: A. Concordances; - B. Genealogy of the Family of the Agoranomoi; - C. Structure of the Agoranomic Contract and Three Samples; - D. Document Groups: Scribal Practices and Variation. - General Index.
